intro: Pimpinella wallichiana var. katrajensis, commonly known as the Katrajens mountain caraway, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes herbs like parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are followed by small, ovoid fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. The leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its use in local herbal remedies.
